intro: Lasianthus fordii f. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy lasianthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to China and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
